tweets.text:
Hey #Stamford - did you see Chris and Andy in the millstream today?

They were removing protective cages from coir rolls that are greening up Bath Row with native wetland plantsüåøA great day to be out - blues skies, warm sun and kingfishers!üå§Ô∏è #riverwelland @EnvAgency @StamfordTC https://t.co/lUXO9Mhe0t

Some news! After five brilliant years I leave my job leading flood in #TeamEA - but I don‚Äôt go far- from today I‚Äôm our Exec Director of Operations working with our frontline teams on all EA activities water, biodiversity, regulating industry and of course floods! Can‚Äôt wait :) https://t.co/FkeIBPvdth

tweets.text:
@JonTolleyTweets @jnsweeneytweets @RBKingston @sleighbayley No need to apologise, Jon. 
Seems the system‚Äôs being played. 
Have heard 1 story of scaffold poles being sunk into the river bed for mooring to put onus on @EnvAgencySE 
Various authorities need to work together to close any loopholes to ensure people are safeguarded.

Monitoring #NFM benefits of tree planting and enhanced floodplain storage on Lowther Estate showcased by @ITVBorder on Friday. Thanks to our partner @lowthercastle and our funders @EnvAgencyNW and @UKRI_News (@NERC_QNFM). Watch: https://t.co/xdYUmfh5px https://t.co/H6Rw39T8Em

First beaver dam in Cumbria for 400 years @lowthercastle gets new discharge and storage monitoring to show #NFM benefits. Thank you @EnvAgencyNW for funding, and @ITVBorder for reporting. ITV News report and video:  https://t.co/75ehRa7hAx https://t.co/IUzbxaG0pn

‚ö†Ô∏è FLOOD ALERTS ‚ö†Ô∏è

Flood Alerts have been issued for the River Severn & Upper Teme in #Shropshire, more rain is expected tomorrow with minor flooding expected on the Severn over the weekend & into next week. I'll keep you up to date or visit the @EnvAgency for more info. https://t.co/txnHLD9e23

@MilesKing10 Not just trout, @bettwsresident tells me salmon were spawning in that section of the river the week before work started.

We wait to see how the @EnvAgency proceed. But to be clear, If we can't conserve one of the most heavily protected rivers in the country what chance the rest?

tweets.text: @InsideCroydon @CleanAirUK @plumeplotter @LBSEnvironment @Mrploemic We have similar issue with  @EnvAgency it‚Äôs backing incineration to the hilt - not sure how this fits in with #netzero hypocrisy they now seem to spout most days -

The #BostonBarrier is the first @EnvAgency project which retrospectively looked at @GlobalGoalsUN. We can evidence achievements against all 17 #GlobalGoals & this work is now used as a benchmark within the EA for all future major projects.

üìΩÔ∏èWatch as @johncurtinEA explains more: https://t.co/4Kxnw84SZX
Our officers have been training staff from @islandRoads this week to deploy a temporary #flood barrier at #Cowes quickly and safely during extreme high tides. https://t.co/8eMcPqyK3T
The second phase of the #Cowes scheme will be delivered in spring 2021 where we will improve the resilience of individual residential properties by fitting measures such as flood doors.

Well now everyone agrees with us #cowboys @viridor_dunbar and others finally getting found out dealing with hazardous and non hazardous infectious waste through plants not designed to deal with it @EnvAgency @scottishepa all involved in @scotgov @ukgov @coverups all illegal #scum https://t.co/cMzCYITYg0

2020 has felt a bit of a washout sometimes, but rainfall data shows it to be above the long term average tho‚Äô not especially wet

Esteemed colleague Beth @EnvAgencySE generated these cumulative rainfall graphs from rain gauges in the Test, Itchen and Meon #chalkstream catchments https://t.co/cSjUMZfU6z

‚ÄúOne striking result we see already is that a fully collaborative project delivers massive, multiple benefits for people, for wildlife and the economy ‚Äì more so than by organisations working alone"
